docs.lead_paragraph: A state Senator's blog post likening the insurance requirement under President Barack Obama's health care law to the forced deportation of Jews during the Holocaust drew swift condemnation Monday from leaders of both parties in Tennessee.
docs.snippet: A state Senator's blog post likening the insurance requirement under President Barack Obama's health care law to the forced deportation of Jews during the Holocaust drew swift condemnation Monday from leaders of both parties in Tennessee.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the latest prep work for a presidential campaign, Rand Paul is conspicuously courting moderate and establishment Republicans while Ted Cruz keeps up a travel schedule that has 2016 written all over it.
docs.snippet: In the latest prep work for a presidential campaign, Rand Paul is conspicuously courting moderate and establishment Republicans while Ted Cruz keeps up a travel schedule that has 2016 written all over it.

docs.lead_paragraph: The percentage of adults in the United States who lack health insurance has fallen to its lowest rate since 2008, down to about 13 percent in April from a peak of 18 percent last year, according to a Gallup poll released on Monday.

headline.main: Fewer in U.S. Lack Health Insurance, but Issues Remain: Poll
headline.print_headline: Fewer in U.S. Lack Health Insurance, but Issues Remain: Poll

docs.snippet: The percentage of adults in the United States who lack health insurance has fallen to its lowest rate since 2008, down to about 13 percent in April from a peak of 18 percent last year, according to a Gallup poll released on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Oberstar, a Democrat, served in the House for 36 years and led the Transportation Committee before a Tea Party-backed candidate defeated him in 2010.

headline.main: James Oberstar, 79, Congressman Ousted in Tea Party Tide, Dies

docs.abstract: James L Oberstar, Democrat who served in House of Representatives for 36 years, dies at age 79.
docs.snippet: Mr. Oberstar, a Democrat, served in the House for 36 years and led the Transportation Committee before a Tea Party-backed candidate defeated him in 2010.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans’ response to health reform’s success is to close their eyes and sling bad statistics.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column criticizes House Republicans for releasing a deliberately misleading report on the status of health care reform; holds their crude rigging of numbers was meant to sustain illusion of failure in the face of unexpected success; laments that there is no sign that Republicans will pay a political price for deliberately misinforming the public.
docs.snippet: Republicans’ response to health reform’s success is to close their eyes and sling bad statistics.

docs.lead_paragraph: An assortment of records compiled by a retired agency analyst points to a camp north of San Antonio as the site of “Midwest Depot,” a classified weapons stockpile.

headline.main: Arms Cache Most Likely Kept in Texas by the C.I.A.
headline.print_headline: Arms Cache Most Likely Kept in Texas by the C.I.A.

docs.abstract: Assortment of documents and records compiled by retired Central Intelligence Agency analyst Allen Thomson points to camp north of San Antonio as site of so-called Midwest Depot, where classified weapons stockpile is kept; Thomson argues that history of depot should be scrutinized.
docs.snippet: An assortment of records compiled by a retired agency analyst points to a camp north of San Antonio as the site of “Midwest Depot,” a classified weapons stockpile.

byline.contributor: Mark Mazzetti contributed reporting from Washington. Kitty Bennett contributed research from St. Petersburg, Fla.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Barack Obama poked fun at himself and what he called a hard year but aimed his most caustic humor at Washington gridlock when political and media luminaries gathered at the annual White House Correspondents' Association dinner.

headline.main: Washington Gridlock Butt of Obama Jokes at White House Correspondents' Dinner
headline.print_headline: Washington Gridlock Butt of Obama Jokes at White House Correspondents' Dinner

docs.snippet: U.S. President Barack Obama poked fun at himself and what he called a hard year but aimed his most caustic humor at Washington gridlock when political and media luminaries gathered at the annual White House Correspondents' Association dinner.

docs.lead_paragraph: Besides his usual targets, President Obama took shots at the botched rollout of HealthCare.gov at the annual White House Correspondents’ Association dinner.

headline.main: Comedian in Chief’s New Punch Line: Obamacare
headline.print_headline: Comedian in Chief’s New Punch Line: Obamacare

docs.abstract: President Obama, at annual White House Correspondents’ Association dinner, takes shots at his usual targets, and also at the botched rollout of HealthCare.gov.
docs.snippet: Besides his usual targets, President Obama took shots at the botched rollout of HealthCare.gov at the annual White House Correspondents’ Association dinner.

docs.lead_paragraph: New York Times employees, including Executive Editor Jill Abramson, share how being hit by vehicles made a lasting impact on them.

headline.seo: How Being Hit by a Vehicle Changed Times Colleagues’ Lives
headline.main: Struck on the Street: Four Survivors

docs.abstract: New York Times Executive Editor Jill Abramson describes how being hit and badly injured by delivery truck while walking in New York City in 2007 forever changed the way she experiences the city; presents stories of three other Times employees who were hit by vehicles and survived; comments on Mayor Michael R Bloomberg's reduction of traffic fatalities by 30 percent during his tenure, spate of awful accidents in 2014, and Mayor Bill de Blasio's goal of further reducing deadly accidents.
docs.snippet: New York Times employees, including Executive Editor Jill Abramson, share how being hit by vehicles made a lasting impact on them.

byline.contributor: Denise Fuhs, Andrew Kueneman and Mick Sussman contributed reporting.
